recipes.title: Ava Makes a Burger!
recipes.intro: Ava is firing up the grill to make the juiciest, cheesiest burger ever!
recipes.introFact: Americans eat about 50 billion burgers every year — that’s a LOT of burgers!
recipes.completionMessage: A big, juicy burger stacked high — time to eat!
recipes.completionFact: The hamburger became famous at the 1904 World’s Fair in St. Louis!

steps.story: Tap to shape the beef into a round patty!
steps.fact: The best burgers are shaped gently — don’t squish the meat too hard!

steps.story: Drag the patty onto the hot grill!
steps.fact: That sizzling sound means the grill is nice and hot!

steps.story: Hold to cook the patty until it’s perfectly done!
steps.fact: Cheeseburgers were invented by adding a slice of cheese right at the end!

steps.story: Tap to add lettuce, tomato, and cheese on top!
steps.fact: Everyone builds their burger differently — that’s what makes it fun!

recipes.title: Ava’s Perfect Pizza!
recipes.intro: Pizza night! Ava is making a pizza from scratch with all her favourite toppings!
recipes.introFact: Pizza became hugely popular in America after soldiers brought the recipe back from Italy after World War II!
recipes.completionMessage: Bubbly, cheesy pizza fresh from the oven — slice and enjoy!
recipes.completionFact: Pepperoni is the most popular pizza topping in America!

steps.story: Tap to knead the pizza dough until it’s stretchy!
steps.fact: Pizza dough needs yeast to make it rise and get bubbly!

steps.story: Stir the tomato sauce in circles over the dough!
steps.fact: The sauce goes on first — spread it all the way to the edges!

steps.story: Drag the cheese and toppings onto the pizza!
steps.fact: Mozzarella cheese gets all stretchy and gooey when it melts!

steps.story: Hold to bake the pizza in the hot oven!
steps.fact: New York pizza is thin and foldable, but Chicago pizza is thick and deep!

recipes.title: Ava’s Ballpark Hot Dog!
recipes.intro: It’s game day! Ava is making classic American hot dogs for everyone!
recipes.introFact: Hot dogs are a must-have at every baseball game in America!
recipes.completionMessage: A classic hot dog with all the fixings — play ball!
recipes.completionFact: Americans eat about 20 billion hot dogs every year!

steps.story: Drag the hot dog onto the grill!
steps.fact: Hot dogs sizzle and get grill marks on the barbecue!

steps.story: Hold to grill until the hot dog is sizzling!
steps.fact: The famous Nathan’s hot dog eating contest happens every July 4th!

steps.story: Tap to place it in the bun!
steps.fact: Hot dog buns were invented so people wouldn’t burn their hands!

steps.story: Tap to squirt mustard and ketchup on top!
steps.fact: In Chicago, people never put ketchup on a hot dog — only mustard!

recipes.title: Ava’s Fluffy Pancakes!
recipes.intro: Good morning! Ava is flipping fluffy pancakes for a special weekend breakfast!
recipes.introFact: Pancakes have been eaten in America since the very first colonists arrived!
recipes.completionMessage: A tall stack of fluffy pancakes with maple syrup — breakfast is served!
recipes.completionFact: Maple syrup comes from the sap of maple trees — it takes 40 gallons of sap to make 1 gallon of syrup!

steps.story: Tap to crack the eggs into the bowl!
steps.fact: Eggs help make pancakes fluffy and golden!

steps.story: Drag the flour and milk into the bowl!
steps.fact: Buttermilk is the secret to extra fluffy pancakes!

steps.story: Stir the batter gently — a few lumps are OK!
steps.fact: Over-mixing makes pancakes tough — lumpy batter is perfect!

steps.story: Hold to cook until bubbles appear, then flip!
steps.fact: When you see bubbles on top, it’s time to flip!

recipes.title: Ava’s Donut Shop!
recipes.intro: Ava is making donuts from scratch — with icing and sprinkles on top!
recipes.introFact: The donut hole was invented so the middle would cook evenly — clever!
recipes.completionMessage: Colourful donuts with icing and sprinkles — too pretty to eat!
recipes.completionFact: Americans eat over 10 billion donuts every year!

steps.story: Tap to mix the flour, sugar, and eggs into dough!
steps.fact: Donut dough is soft and slightly sweet!

steps.story: Stir the dough until it’s smooth and round!
steps.fact: Donuts are shaped in a ring so they cook evenly in the oil!

steps.story: Hold to fry the donuts until they’re golden!
steps.fact: Donuts only need about 2 minutes in the hot oil to turn golden!

steps.story: Tap to add icing and sprinkles on top!
steps.fact: National Donut Day is celebrated on the first Friday in June!

recipes.title: Ava’s Ice Cream Sundae!
recipes.intro: It’s a hot summer day! Ava is making the most amazing ice cream sundae!
recipes.introFact: The ice cream cone was invented at the 1904 World’s Fair when a vendor ran out of cups!
recipes.completionMessage: Scoops of ice cream with toppings galore — the perfect treat!
recipes.completionFact: Americans eat about 1.5 billion gallons of ice cream each year!

steps.story: Drag the cream and sugar into the ice cream maker!
steps.fact: Ice cream is made by freezing cream while stirring it!

steps.story: Stir and churn until the ice cream is thick and creamy!
steps.fact: Vanilla is the most popular ice cream flavour in America!

steps.story: Tap to scoop the ice cream into a bowl!
steps.fact: A perfect scoop should be round like a ball!

steps.story: Tap to add sprinkles, sauce, and a cherry on top!
steps.fact: The cherry on top of a sundae became famous in the early 1900s!

recipes.title: Ava’s Crispy Fried Chicken!
recipes.intro: Ava is learning her grandma’s secret recipe for the crispiest fried chicken!
recipes.introFact: Southern fried chicken is one of America’s most famous and beloved dishes!
recipes.completionMessage: Golden, crispy fried chicken — finger-lickin’ good!
recipes.completionFact: The secret to great fried chicken is soaking it in buttermilk first!

steps.story: Drag the chicken into the buttermilk to soak!
steps.fact: Buttermilk makes the chicken super tender and juicy!

steps.story: Tap to coat the chicken in seasoned flour!
steps.fact: The spice blend in the flour is usually a family secret!

steps.story: Stir the chicken gently in the hot oil!
steps.fact: The oil needs to be very hot so the crust gets extra crispy!

steps.story: Hold to fry until the chicken is golden brown and crunchy!
steps.fact: Fried chicken is a favourite food for picnics and family gatherings!

recipes.title: Ava Bakes Apple Pie!
recipes.intro: It’s autumn! Ava picked fresh apples and is baking a classic American apple pie!
recipes.introFact: The saying “as American as apple pie” shows just how loved this dessert is!
recipes.completionMessage: A golden, cinnamon-scented apple pie — best served warm!
recipes.completionFact: Apple pie has been eaten in America since the 1600s!

steps.story: Tap to peel and slice the apples!
steps.fact: Granny Smith apples are perfect for pie because they’re tart and hold their shape!

steps.story: Drag the apple slices into the pie crust!
steps.fact: Stack the apple slices high — they shrink down as they bake!

steps.story: Tap to sprinkle cinnamon and sugar on top!
steps.fact: Cinnamon and apples are a match made in heaven!

steps.story: Hold to bake the pie until the crust is golden and flaky!
steps.fact: Many people serve apple pie warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!

recipes.title: Ava’s Super Sandwich!
recipes.intro: Lunchtime! Ava is building the tallest, tastiest sandwich for a picnic!
recipes.introFact: The sandwich is named after the Earl of Sandwich from England — but Americans made it famous!
recipes.completionMessage: A big, colourful sandwich — packed with delicious layers!
recipes.completionFact: Peanut butter and jelly is the most popular kids’ sandwich in America!

steps.story: Tap to lay out the bread slices!
steps.fact: Sliced bread was invented in 1928 — that’s why people say “the best thing since sliced bread!”

steps.story: Drag the turkey, cheese, and veggies onto the bread!
steps.fact: Americans invented famous sandwiches like the club and the Reuben!

steps.story: Tap to add lettuce, tomato, and sauce!
steps.fact: Fresh vegetables make a sandwich crunchy and colourful!

steps.story: Tap to close and cut the sandwich in half!
steps.fact: Cutting a sandwich diagonally makes it look extra fancy!

recipes.title: Ava’s Milkshake Bar!
recipes.intro: Ava is blending the thickest, creamiest milkshake at her very own milkshake bar!
recipes.introFact: Milkshakes became super popular in American diners in the 1950s!
recipes.completionMessage: A thick, creamy milkshake with whipped cream on top — slurp!
recipes.completionFact: The electric blender was invented in 1922 and made milkshakes thick and creamy!

steps.story: Drag the ice cream and milk into the blender!
steps.fact: The more ice cream you add, the thicker the shake!

steps.story: Tap to add strawberries for flavour!
steps.fact: Chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry are the three classic milkshake flavours!

steps.story: Stir and blend until it’s thick and smooth!
steps.fact: A good milkshake should be so thick you can barely get it through the straw!

steps.story: Tap to add whipped cream and a cherry on top!
steps.fact: Classic American diners serve milkshakes in tall metal cups!
